answers.answer: Hi,How are you? It is good that the CT scan result was fine. However, do you have co-morbid conditions such as hypertension, diabetes or high cholesterol? One differential of morning headache is hypertension headache. It presents with generalized pain, most severe in the morning and it usually diminishes throughout day.  It is important that the blood pressure is controlled. Aside from this, management of headaches include rest, ice packs, analgesics and identification of the possible triggers. Triggers include food, weather, altitude, stress,  hormones and other factors. There is a headache tracker here in Medhelp that may be of help. But if you experience increasing pain, double vision, rigid neck have this checked immediately for proper management. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: Hello. I am 35 years old and for the past 10 weeks noticed a head ache that wont go away. For the past 2 weeks it became worst that when I wake up I have a head ached on my right side of my head and the back especially. I was in the emergency 2 days ago for 9 hours and was informed after a CT scan that it showed brain spasms.My CT was clear of any abnormalities which was a relief. However, I do not know what do go from here. My family doctor is on vacation and she will back in 2 weeks. I need advise as to how to proceed, it feels like theres a hand gripping my right side of my skull and its fingers feels like a web of pain.
title: MORNING HEADACHE
